alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a transition metal and a cyanide ion [C-]#N.
alternative_parents.name: Transition metal cyanide salts

alternative_parents.description: Inorganic compounds consisting of an assembly of cations and anions.
alternative_parents.name: Inorganic salts

alternative_parents.description: Inorganic chemical compounds with one or more oxygen atoms combined with another element.
alternative_parents.name: Inorganic oxides

alternative_parents.description: Inorganic compounds of nitrogen where nitrogen has a formal oxidation state of -3.
alternative_parents.name: Inorganic nitrides

alternative_parents.description: Inorganic compounds in which hydrogen is bonded to a more electropositive element or group. Usually, they contain one or more hydrogen centers having nucleophilic, reducing, or basic properties.
alternative_parents.name: Inorganic hydrides

alternative_parents.description: Inorganic compounds that contain the cyano group (-[C-]#[N+]).
alternative_parents.name: Inorganic cyanides

alternative_parents.description: Inorganic compounds containing a mercury atom.
alternative_parents.name: Inorganic mercury compounds

class.description: Inorganic oxoanionic compounds in which the heaviest atom not in an oxoanion is a transition metal.
class.name: Transition metal oxoanionic compounds

description: This compound belongs to the class of inorganic compounds known as transition metal hydroxides. These are inorganic compounds in which the largest oxoanion is hydroxide, and in which the heaviest atom not in an oxoanion is a transition metal.

direct_parent.description: Inorganic compounds in which the largest oxoanion is hydroxide, and in which the heaviest atom not in an oxoanion is a transition metal.
direct_parent.name: Transition metal hydroxides

kingdom.description: Compounds that do not contain a C atom. Exceptions are made for isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon trioxide, carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Inorganic compounds

subclass.description: Inorganic compounds in which the largest oxoanion is hydroxide, and in which the heaviest atom not in an oxoanion is a transition metal.
subclass.name: Transition metal hydroxides

superclass.description: Compounds that contains both metal and non metal atoms.
superclass.name: Mixed metal/non-metal compounds
